meanings.definition: Somewhat young in age or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The puppy looked youngish with its playful behavior.
meanings.sent2: She wore a youngish outfit to the party.
meanings.sent3: The old cat tried to act youngish by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The garden had a youngish feel with its vibrant flowers.
meanings.sent5: The youngish tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: His energetic dance moves were youngish and full of life.
meanings.sent2: The painting captured a youngish spirit with its bright colors.
meanings.sent3: The grandpa's attempt at skateboarding was quite youngish.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was youngish, contagious and carefree.
meanings.sent5: The youngish enthusiasm of the students was inspiring.
